oai_dc:dc.dc:title: COUNTRY-SPECIFIC ANALYSIS of COMPETITIVENESS AND RESILIENCE OF ORGANIC AND LOW INPUT DAIRY FARMING ACROSS EUROPE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hamerlinck, Jolien
Bijttebier , Jo
Lauwers, Ludwig
Moakes, Simon
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm economics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An EU-wide analysis of economic performance of organic and low input dairy farms has been done. Relative profitability of organic and LI farms is country specific. countries' low input farms differ in their resiliences to price shocks.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hamerlinck, Jolien; Bijttebier , Jo; Lauwers, Ludwig and Moakes, Simon (2014) COUNTRY-SPECIFIC ANALYSIS of COMPETITIVENESS AND RESILIENCE OF ORGANIC AND LOW INPUT DAIRY FARMING ACROSS EUROPE. In: Rahmann, G. and Aksoy, U. (Eds.) Building Organic Bridges, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut, Braunschweig, Germany, 1, Thuenen Report, no. 20, pp. 61-64.
